com.jmex.physics.vehicle
Class Car

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.vehicle.Vehicle
      com.jmex.physics.vehicle.Car

public class Car
extends Vehicle

What sets a Car apart from other Vehicles is that it steers with its front wheels (number: 0, 1), and can be driven by using both conventional and four-wheeled drive. This leads to that the number of wheels must be four. It also has a handbrake.

By default the steering wheel and thus the front wheels can be turned in a 20 degree angle.

TODO: gear box and better brake handling.

Author:
Per Thulin

Constructor Detail

Car

public Car(DynamicPhysicsObject chassis,
           DynamicPhysicsObject[] wheels,
           float enginePower,
           float suspention,
           boolean fourWheeled,
           com.jme.math.Vector3f frontAxleCenter,
           com.jme.math.Vector3f endAxleCenter,
           float axleLength)
Creates a new Car with the given chassis geometry and mass. Also one of the parameters is an array of car wheels. They are positioned using the three last parameters.

Parameters:
chassis - The DynamicPhysicsObject that makes out the chassis of the vehicle.
wheels - The wheels of the car. Each wheel is connected to the chassis via an Hinge2Joint
enginePower - The power of the engine. A heavy vehicle needs a powerful engine.
suspention - A lower value stiffens the suspention.
fourWheeled - Signals if this Car is to be four-wheeled driven.
frontAxleCenter - The center of the front wheel axle (relative to the center of the car chassis).
endAxleCenter - The center of the back wheel axle (relative to the center of the car chassis).
axleLength - The length of the car axles. They are assumed to be of the same length.
Method Detail

setSteeringWheel

public void setSteeringWheel(float percent)
Description copied from class: Vehicle
Sets how many percents of the maximum angle the steering wheel is rotated in. A value of 1 means that it's fully rotated to the right, and a value of -1 means that it's fully rotated to the left.

Specified by:
setSteeringWheel in class Vehicle
Parameters:
percent - A value that can range from -1 to 1.
See Also:
Vehicle.setSteeringWheel(float)

setGasPedal

public void setGasPedal(float percent)
Description copied from class: Vehicle
Sets how hard the gas pedal is being stepped on (e.g. how many percent of the maximum speed that is being targetted). A value of 1 means that it's fully down, and a value of -1 means that it's in full reverse (hehe yeah I know, that doesn't make much sense). And well, yes, you guessed right: a value of 0 means that it isn't pressed at all.

Specified by:
setGasPedal in class Vehicle
Parameters:
percent - A value that can range from -1 to 1.
See Also:
Vehicle.setGasPedal(float)

getGasPedal

public float getGasPedal()
Description copied from class: Vehicle
Gets the amount of gas that is being applied. A value of 1 means that the gas pedal is fully down, and a value of -1 means that we are in full reverse.

Overrides:
getGasPedal in class Vehicle
Returns:
The amount of gas that is being applied.
